comments:
From bug 128972:

I am having trouble again in this setting using RC4. See output below. Hope you
can help!!! Thanks!!!

(runtime workbench is started with JDK 1.4.2)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2006-05-15 13:40:12.929
!MESSAGE Error installing bundle:

Martin, 
what exactly is your target composed of?

Eclipse 3.1 did not set the org.osgi.framework.executionenvironment correctly.  To work around the issue you should set the property yourself.  For example, on J2SE-1.5 you would use the following property.

org.osgi.framework.executionenvironment=OSGi/Minimum-1.0,OSGi/Minimum-1.1,JRE-1.1,J2SE-1.2,J2SE-1.3,J2SE-1.4,J2SE-1.5

Eclipse 3.2 sets the property correctly for the various JRE levels.
Tom, so the stack in comment 0 indicates that org.eclipse.osgi 3.1.x is being used here?

My development environment is 3.2RC4, my target environment contains osgi and core.runtime of 3.1 as well as several self-implemented plugins.

Worked some milestones back in time (maybe RC1 & RC2, definitely M6).

Then Tom's theory in comment 2 is correct.

The problem surfaced because JDT (and all other plug-ins in the sdk) have specified their EE in the late RC* cycles.

Moving to Equinox as the problem is in osgi 3.1

What's the solution here?  Should we remove the EE from jdt.junit.runtime, pde.junit.runtime and org.junit?  or is the workaround sufficient?

Note that the problem only occurs when you are running Plugin JUnit tests in pre-3.2 targets not containing the three plugins listed above.
A solution cannot involve removing the EE headers.  I think the work around should be sufficient.  If so I would like to close as WONTFIX.
The work around is completely sufficient for me. So would be okay for me to close as WONTFIX.
